org.vu.contest

Class ContestRecords

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vu.contest.ContestRecords
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ContestRecords
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

    This class is used to store the records of contest entries during the course of a contest. It implements the Serializable interface, thus, objects of this class can be stored to and loaded from files.

    A ContestRecords object maintains a Vector of objects of class ContestEntry for every player ID (String) encountered so far. It also keeps track of the time of the last update (i.e. the timestamp of the last inserted entry).

    ATTENTION: It is assumed that entries are added in proper chronological order, i.e. if entry B is added after entry A then the timestamp of entry B should be equal to or greater than the timestamp of entry A. Similarly, when deriving current rankings with method getRankings the entry that was last added for each player is taken into account as is considered to be representing the last submission of the player.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      ContestRecords()
      Creates a new ContestRecords object with empty record and time of last update to be 0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContestRecords

        public ContestRecords()
        Creates a new ContestRecords object with empty record and time of last update to be 0.

    • Method Detail

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(ContestEntry entry)
        Adds a new entry to the records. The entry is added to the end of the Vector corresponding to the player ID in the entry argument. If that Vector does not exist (this is the first entry of this player ever added to this records object) a new Vector is created and associated to the player ID and the entry added to it. The update time of this ContestRecords object is set to be equal to the timestamp of the argument entry.
        Parameters:
        entry - The entry to be added to the record.

      • addEntries

        public void addEntries(java.util.Vector<ContestEntry> entries)
        Adds all the entries in the entries Vector. Each entry is added with the addEntry method. The elements are added in the order found in the entries vector.
        Parameters:
        entries - A Vector of objects of class ContestEntry

      • getLastUpdate

        public long getLastUpdate()
        Returns the time of the last update. This time is equal to the timestamp of the last entry added (see method addEntry).
        Returns:
        The time (in seconds since 1/1/1970) of the last update of the records.

      • getRankings

        public java.util.Vector<ContestEntry> getRankings(java.lang.String evaluation)
        Returns the current rankings for an evaluation. Rankings are calculated using the last added entry of each player (assuming it corresponds to the player's latest submission). Only player IDs found in the records (i.e. players that have made at least one submission) are included in the rankings. Comparisons between entries are performed using the EntryComparator class.
        Parameters:
        evaluation - A String representing an evaluation id.
        Returns:
        A Vector of objects. If a argument evaluation is a valid evaluation ID then elements are ranked in ascending order, i.e. the current winner is in the last, otherwise they are in random order. position of the vector.

      • storeRecord

        public static void storeRecord(ContestRecords record,
                               java.lang.String file)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Stores a ContestRecrods object to a file.
        Parameters:
        record - The records object to be stored.
        file - The name of the file the record will be stored to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while writing to the file.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the target file cannot be opened.

      • loadRecord

        public static ContestRecords loadRecord(java.lang.String file)
                                 throws java.io.InvalidObjectException,
                                        java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                        java.io.IOException,
                                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Loads a ContestRecords object from a file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file the records object will be loaded from.
        Returns:
        A ContestRecords object loaded from the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading from the file.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be opened.
        java.io.InvalidObjectException - if the file does not contain a valid ContestRecords object.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of the object in file cannot be determined.
